intro: Roupala chrysogenia, commonly known as the golden roupala, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shrub form, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a leathery texture. The flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are pollinated primarily by insects.
